Name: Stela of Ka-mher-ibsen
Description: In the lunette of this stela are two udjat-eyes flanking a shen-ring. Underneath is a man shown in front of an offering table. He is seated on a chair with predatory cat's feet and a high backrest. With his left hand he is holding a lotus flower to his nose, and in his right is a napkin. In front of him is offering table piled high with loaves, pieces of fruit and meat. The name of the man is written above the offering table. The scenes are in raised relief, the hieroglyphs are incised. There are still some traces of paint.
